metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2284 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-athena - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-lesstif - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-nox - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm11').
